question.title: Why is virtual thread on java is set as daemon?
question.body:
In JEP 444, I could see the following:

Virtual threads are always daemon threads. The Thread.setDaemon(boolean) method cannot change a virtual thread to be a non-daemon thread.

But what is the reason behind it? As per my understanding , you will mark those Threads daemon whose completion you do not always care. Therefore, does it mean you should use virtual thread only if you do not care it's completion ( I do not think so :) )?
